sections.title: Introduction â€” GitHub Copilot integration with Visual Studio
sections.summary: Presenter introduces GitHub Copilot integration inside Visual Studio (preview). Mentions main features such as inline suggestions while coding and the 'next edit' suggestion.
key_actions: Open Visual Studio with Copilot integration
Run the preview version of the Copilot extension
Observe inline suggestions and next-edit suggestions while coding

sections.title: Usage and consumption / plan status
sections.summary: Shows consumption/usage information for the Copilot plan (example: 28% of pro plan used for premium requests) and notes other resources are available.

sections.title: Solution architecture and Copilot modes
sections.summary: Describes the solution components (orchestrators, backend, AI front end, models) and explains Copilot can operate in two modes: Ask mode for Q&A and an interactive Agent mode for more hands-on coding assistance.
key_actions: Identify project solution components (orchestrators, backend, front end, models)
Choose between Ask mode and Agent mode depending on the task
Use Ask mode to query about the system and Agent mode for interactive coding
ui_elements: Solution/project structure (orchestrators, backend, front end, models)

sections.title: Model selection and querying Copilot
sections.summary: Demonstrates asking Copilot which OpenAI model the solution is using and selecting a model (example shown: switching to GPT-5). Notes a full set of models is available in the selector.
key_actions: Ask Copilot which model the solution currently uses
Open the model selector and choose a model (e.g., GPT-5)
Review the model options and Copilot's response

sections.title: Copilot analysis and upgrade actions
sections.summary: Copilot reports details about configured models (example mentions app host defining specific models and embeddings). The user asks Copilot to create a plan to upgrade to GPT-5 and to consider switching to local models. Copilot is described as capable of applying changes to code (C#) and infrastructure (Bicep) files to perform upgrades.
key_actions: Request Copilot to analyze currently configured models and embeddings
Ask Copilot to create a plan for upgrading to GPT-5
Ask Copilot about switching to local models
Allow Copilot to modify project files (C#) and infrastructure templates (Bicep) to implement changes

main_topics: GitHub Copilot integration in Visual Studio
Preview features: inline suggestions and next-edit
Solution architecture (orchestrators, backend, front end, models)
Copilot modes: Ask mode and Agent mode
Automated updates to code and infrastructure files (C# and Bicep)
